subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Tuesday, 22 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Sidwell agrees switch to Chelsea
Chelsea confirm midfielder Steve Sidwell has agreed to join the
club on a free transfer.



 
Robson unveiled as Sheff Utd boss
Bryan Robson is confirmed as the new manager of Sheffield United.



 
FA takes tough stance on tickets
The FA considers legal action against anyone who sold FA Cup final tickets illegally.








GOLF




Olazabal & McGinley to help Faldo
European Ryder Cup captain Nick Faldo names Jose Maria Olazabal and Paul McGinley as his two assistants for next year's competition in America.



 
Woosnam to miss Wentworth event
Illness forces Ian Woosnam out the PGA Championship at Wentworth.



 
Injured Howell to miss Wentworth
Defending champion David Howell withdraws from this week's PGA Championship with a back injury.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton plays down Monaco hopes
Lewis Hamilton says he is "realistic" about winning the Monaco Grand Prix on his Formula One debut in the Principality.



 
China's F1 track chief dismissed
The head of China's Formula One track and two others are fired over Shanghai's ongoing pension corruption scandal.



 
Vermeulen wins in rainy Le Mans
Suzuki's Chris Vermeulen wins a rain-swept French MotoGP at Le Mans.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton plays down Monaco hopes
Lewis Hamilton says he is "realistic" about winning the Monaco Grand Prix on his Formula One debut in the Principality.



 
China's F1 track chief dismissed
The head of China's Formula One track and two others are fired over Shanghai's ongoing pension corruption scandal.



 
Mosley steps up push for green F1
Formula One boss Max Mosley is proposing a raft of changes to help accelerate the adoption of "green" technology.








ATHLETICS




Pavey races to Manchester victory
Britain's Jo Pavey produces a world-class performance to win the Great Manchester Run.



 
Sayers sets new UK javelin record
Goldie Sayers breaks the British javelin record with a throw of 65.05m at the Loughborough International meeting.



 
GB trio shine in Great Wall test
Britain has three top-10 finishers in China's Great Wall Marathon as Salvador Calvo smashes the record in one of the world's toughest 26-mile races.








CYCLING




Cavendish sprints to Spanish win
Britain's Mark Cavendish wins the second stage of the Tour of Catalonia, edging a mass sprint at the finish.



 
Noe claims lead in Giro d'Italia
Andrea Noe claims the overall Giro d'Italia lead as Leonardo Piepoli wins the 10th stage.



 
Napolitano upsets rival Petacchi
Danilo Napolitano spoils Alessandro Petacchi's hopes of taking a hometown win on stage nine of the Giro d'Italia.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Lawro says what he thinks about the FA Cup final, plus Mourinho & Warnock



 
Comment: Cup of little cheer
Robbo gives his verdict on "dull" FA Cup final 



 
Victory is sweet for Pete
Pete Doherty scores the winner as his side win football event
